panel.html:
Tenable Identity Exposure allows organizations to secure their infrastructure by addressing identity as a primary attack surface. The platform supports anticipating threats, detecting breaches, and responding to incidents and attacks that involve Active Directory environments.

Identity systems underpin access to applications, data, and infrastructure. Weaknesses in directory configuration, privilege distribution, delegation models, and trust relationships frequently determine how attacks succeed, how far they spread, and how difficult they are to contain.

Tenable Identity Exposure provides continuous visibility into Active Directory environments, enabling organizations to monitor identity posture as it exists in practice. This includes observing identities, group memberships, privilege assignments, delegation configurations, and trust relationships as they evolve over time.

Through centralized dashboards, Tenable Identity Exposure enables security and identity teams to identify the most critical vulnerabilities affecting Active Directory at a glance. These vulnerabilities are presented in context, allowing teams to understand which conditions materially affect security posture and require action.

For each identified vulnerability, Tenable Identity Exposure provides recommended courses of remediation. This supports a structured approach to reducing identity exposure by linking findings directly to corrective actions within the directory environment.

Indicators of Exposure surface underlying issues affecting Active Directory, such as excessive privileges, unsafe delegation, and dangerous trust relationships. These indicators highlight systemic weaknesses that increase the likelihood and impact of compromise.

Indicators of Attack provide visibility into identity-based attack activity. They enable in-depth analysis of how attacks unfold, how access is gained or escalated, and how attackers move through trust relationships and identity paths during an incident.

The Tenable Identity Exposure for Splunk App surfaces this information directly inside Splunk so Executives, Asset Owners, and operational teams can review, analyze, and act on identity exposure and attack data without logging into the Tenable Identity Exposure interface, learning its workflow, or relying on external BI tools.

panel.title: ðŸ§­ How This App Is Used
panel.html:
This app is designed for both executive consumption and operational analysis.

  • Executives use the dashboards to understand identity risk, concentration of exposure, and progress over time.
  • Security and identity teams use the dashboards and searches to investigate exposure, analyze attack paths, and validate remediation impact.
  • Asset Owners use the app to understand how identity exposure affects the systems they are responsible for.

panel.title: ðŸ”— Why Splunk
panel.html:
Splunk serves as the central analysis and reporting platform for identity exposure data alongside vulnerability, endpoint, cloud, and infrastructure telemetry.

By surfacing Tenable Identity Exposure data inside Splunk, this app enables correlation with other security signals and removes the need for separate dashboards, custom queries, or external reporting tools.
